cyclone.name: HARVEY
cyclone.current_location: about 510 mi SSE of Port O'Connor, Texas
cyclone.trajectory: Tracking slowly northwest toward the central Texas coast, then expected to stall inland and drift slowly north-eastward toward Louisiana late in the 4-5-day period
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: central Texas coast (between Port Mansfield and San Luis Pass, near Port O'Connor)
cyclone.hours_to_offshore: Not expected to pass offshore of New Orleans within the 5-day forecast window

weather_observation.watch_coast: Storm Surge Watch: Port Mansfield TX to High Island TX.  Hurricane Watch: north of Port Mansfield to San Luis Pass TX.  Tropical Storm Watch: Boca De Catan MX to Port Mansfield TX and north of San Luis Pass to High Island TX.
weather_observation.warning_coast: None at this time (warnings expected Thursday for portions of TX coast)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Texas coast from Port Mansfield to High Island and portions of southwestern Louisiana
weather_observation.wind: Low (≤7% chance of sustained tropical-storm-force winds; occasional gusts in outer rainbands possible Friday night through Monday)
weather_observation.storm_surge: No significant storm-surge inundation expected for the New Orleans area under the current track; elevated tides and dangerous rip currents possible along the southeast Louisiana coast
weather_observation.rainfall: Outer rainbands could bring 4–6 inches, locally higher, to southeast Louisiana from late Friday through early next week, producing pockets of flash flooding
weather_observation.other_hazards: Prolonged heavy rain could lead to river rises along lower Mississippi and interfere with port logistics even without direct wind or surge effects
